entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:15AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot And Dry Over Eastern Interior This Weekend... Interior Alaska temperatures will be in the upper 70s and lower 80s today, then rise to between 80 and 90 over the weekend. Conditions are expected to remain dry through the weekend. Conditions are expected to become more smokey over the weekend as well.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:07AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot Over The North Slope This Weekend... Temperatures will warm into the 60s and 70s over the North Slope today, and into the 70s and 80s over the weekend. The hottest temperatures will be inland of the coast. Very warm temperatures will continue into early next week.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:01AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Along The West Coast This Weekend... A strong storm will move northeast to the Central Bering Sea tonight, and then weaken slowly over the weekend. This will bring southeast gale force winds to the Eastern Bering Sea tonight into Saturday. This will cause high surf with minor beach erosion over the Yukon Delta and the Bering Strait and St Lawrence Island late

entry.summary: .A slow-moving weather system will bring periods of heavy rainfall through Saturday, potentially resulting in localized flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Montana, including the following areas,
